content.webTitle: From first period to menopause: share physical experiences of life as a woman

fields.headline: From first period to menopause: share physical experiences of life as a woman
fields.bodyText: The experience of life in a woman’s body can be challenging, embarrassing, funny and even joyful. Is there a physical experience you’ve had as a woman that has had a significant effect on your life – good or bad – and that you consider to be underreported? We’d love to hear your stories, positive or not, affecting, angry or humorous, from your first period to the menopause and beyond. One in five girls and young women in the UK are teased or bullied about their periods, yet some women view menstruation as a “feminine power”. Ten per cent of women consider leaving their jobs due to menopausal symptoms, while for other women the hormonal shift is a liberating experience. Share your experiences From the highs of sexual pleasure and discovery, to the lows of illness, infertility and abuse, we want to hear about women’s experiences with their bodies from birth to old age. Do you remember how it felt to go through puberty? Have you ever suffered from a gynaecological condition? Do you feel you were well-treated by your doctor? And do you now feel comfortable in your body? If you have a memorable story that you would like to tell about anything from ectopic pregnancy to body hair, vaginismus to HRT, do contact us. You can get in touch by filling in the encrypted form below. One of our journalists may contact you to discuss further and we may feature some of your responses in our reporting – we won’t publish anything before speaking with you.
